node.title: Beware the humble mango — it can leave its nasty mark
node.alt: mangos in a box, some sap leaking from top
node.description: Mango sap is a nightmare for farmers and a serious issue for locals. Fruit pickers in the Kimberley are being warned to watch out for the fruit's often painful surprise.
node.content:
["The humble mango. It's delicious, it's nutritious, and it grows in abundance in Australia.", "It could also land you in hospital.", "Georgia Carter knows this from painful experience. She's\u00a0a victim of \"mango burn\".\u00a0", "The rash or burn occurs when fruit sap squirts onto exposed skin, leaving huge welts,\u00a0pustules and scabs.", "", "
Georgia Carter suffered a bad burn from a mango.(ABC Kimberley: Hinako Shiraishi)
", "About 10 years ago, 77 workers\u00a0in the Northern Territory found this out the hard way, ending up\u00a0in Katherine Hospital with\u00a0mango burns.\u00a0", "Georgia's experience was so bad it sent her to hospital.\u00a0", "\u201cI think the problem was that I had put the mangoes in my front pockets, all over me ... I didn\u2019t even think that would happen,\u201d she said.", "A day later, Georgia noticed a small mark near her collarbone.", "\"It genuinely started looking like I had burnt it with a [hair] straightener. That\u2019s what it first looked like, but over the next few days it kept spreading and getting worse and worse,\u201d she said.\u00a0", "", "
The inoffensive mango can leave an unwanted reminder on your skin if you're not careful.
", "It took Georgia a few days to figure out that the rash came from sap.\u00a0", "While backstage at the popular\u00a0Kimberley Girl fashion\u00a0show,\u00a0 the humidity in the air made her rash unbearable.\u00a0", "\"It\u00a0was so itchy and horrible;\u00a0it was all over my neck and throat and everything was swollen.\"", "\"I was on the headset like, 'OK\u00a0I think I need to go to hospital,'\u201d she recalled.", "", "
It took Georgia a few days to figure out the small mark on her neck wasn't from a hair straightener.\u00a0(Supplied: Georgia Carter)
", "After a three-hour wait in the emergency department, she was discharged and given some medication to ease the flare-up, but it didn't help.\u00a0", "\"It kept spreading over the weekend. Luckily, I\u00a0went to the Broome Regional Aboriginal Medical Service, and they gave me everything I needed, like steroid cream.\"", "", "
Brittney Wicksteed says\u00a0she can't recall being taught about mango rash.(ABC Kimberley Jacqueline Lynch)
", "President of the Rural Doctors Association of Western Australia\u00a0Brittney Wicksteed\u00a0said mango rash was also common in the Kimberley.", "\"it's not something we necessarily get taught a great deal about in medical school, but I think any doctor who's worked up in the Kimberley learns about it in their\u00a0first week or two,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"It's essentially a form of contact dermatosis, it's quite common for people to have an allergy to the sap itself ... if you do get mango sap in your eyes, I'd advise you seek medical treatment right away.\"\u00a0", "", "
Chris Robinson knows how painful mango sap burns can be.(ABC Rural: Courtney Fowler)
", "Chris Robinson has run a mango orchard in Kununurra for around thirty years, and he learnt quickly that sap burns aren\u2019t just painful, they\u2019re also unprofitable.", "\u201cMangoes that get sap squirted onto them, they will burn, and they will become unmarketable from a week or ten days later. It does the same thing to your skin ... you learn very quickly to not burn the mangoes, or yourself,\u201d he said", "", "
Once a mango is separated from the stem, it squirts out\u00a0 the dangerous liquid.\u00a0(ABC Rural: Courtney Fowler\u00a0)
", "\"You gotta take them off with long stems. We\u2019ve developed a technique to avoid sap burn but it still does happen occasionally,\u00a0and we suffer through it.\u201d", "", "
This mango picker has seen its fair share of sap and has saved many a fruit\u00a0picker from putting their own skin on the line.\u00a0(ABC Kimberley: Hinako Shiraishi)
", "For Georgia, there's a small white scar on her neck, but that's not the only thing that she's been left with. The fear of going through the pain again has\u00a0left her anxious when it comes to eating the fruit.\u00a0", "\"Everyone should know how much it hurts, it\u2019s like a full-on burn and not fun at all. The thing is people might not realise it\u2019s mango sap as well;\u00a0it came up a day later and I didn\u2019t\u00a0even realise what it was.\"", "Dr Wicksteed says burns aren't the only mango-related emergency incidents she sees.\u00a0", "\"Mango rash is the most common one, but up in the Kimberley you do get the odd person hit on the head by the odd mango or coconut coming through the door.\"", "", "
Mangoes are delicious\u00a0\u2014 and occasionally dangerous.(ABC Rural: Melanie Groves)
"]
